monogr.author: Gore, John, Rector of Wendenlofts, Essex

div.head: TO THE RIGHT WORSHIPFVLL, and most Renowned Knight, Sir PAVL PINDAR, the Friend of the Church, the Father of the Poore, and the Honour of all his Family.
div.p:
WEre it not an Injury to desire, that goodnes shold hinder any man from Glory, I dare say, that all that know you, would unfainedly wish you an immortalitie in this present world, that you might live
for ever to doe good, having done so much good while you live. Howbeit, as tis said of good Iehojada, 2 Chron. 24. 16. when he waxed old and died (though he were but a subject, yet) they buried him among the Kings, Because (saith the Text) hee had done good in Israel, both towards God and towards his House. Even so may it happen to you from the King of Kings. God send you an honourable interment when yo • die, and a Crowne of everlasting Glory when you are dead and gone.
div.closer: Thus Prayes Your poore unworthy Friend, IOHN GORE▪
